kc0OgoDWsRFqy9xkBQFeEQ.text: This is the best and most attractive place in Tempe. Beautiful and gorgeous staff, super cool and relaxing atmosphere. Family oriented, clean and very comfortable area.

DEJWsHxqt4ToXzyrnOjcXw.text: We tried Firebirds a year ago and loved the food but our service was pretty mediocre at best.  Today we were wanting steak so we gave it another chance. WOW!!! Abdullah was our server and he was WONDERFUL. Talk about top notch service and great personality!! The food was great. My husband got the peppercorn sirloin and I had the cilantro chicken. I can't say enough good things about today's experience.  We will be back soon.  Loved it!!

photos.caption: Photo of Firebirds Wood Fired Grill - Chandler, AZ, United States. Cilantro chicken

5SI-bWScamR_2OVfvFMXkA.text: Excellent food and servers!!! Great service and was quickly seated. Recommend reservations.

EV6m3Mrwg1bGHV92GJx09w.text: First timer here.  This place has great food, customer service, and a nice variety to choose from . This place beats places like the nearby Hop Social to me, simply because of price. The food is on par if not better, and its a few bucks less.   We sat at the bar, due to the longer wait on a Friday night. The bartender was pleasant and had some great suggestions with us being first timers.   I had the durango burger and my lady had a salad. The burger was nice with flavor. You could also taste the grill, which is what I wanted. Drinks were nice as well. We both agreed that we'd come back here.

vmz-AFEbTPgKjF73sGAxqQ.text: As we often eat with a group of people with food allergies the establishment's handling of such issues is important to us.  Firebirds was on point today - from our waiter taking note of both gluten free and dairy free people in our party, to the manager stopping by to discuss options.  The food was great all around.   Bonus fact - all wines are half off on Mondays!

KQryDbVzFJ4hEVsvgHQeGA.text: Wow this place is going downhill. Were told 30 to 45 minute wait for a reservation at 7. But we were seated right at 7. Now I am hangry.   They changed the daily soups so the Wednesday beef soup is not here on Wednesday. Some brilliant leader in corporate gave the chef the choice. Well how the hell will I figure out when the chef is going to pick beef soup? All I wanted was the beef soup. Not chili.   Waitress said she will be right back after dropping off drinks. She passed 3 times and didn't stop. Well now it has been 21 minutes and the kids orders are not in yet. Feed the kids! And now they tell me that they are cooking more bread...30 mins in. Orders are finally in.  UPDATE: Food just arrived. 7:53PM for the 7/00 PM reservation.

0m8Q8wmGuBWkY6lS0PIJYQ.text: My husband went here for the first time a few months ago and it was great. The food is wonderful, the service was outstanding, and the environment was so comfortable.

tSnueMCy84iEhzEmcdSRcQ.text: We have been a fan of Firebirds since they opened and it has always been our favorite goto restaurant.  We could count on great ambience, service and food.  Over the last two years all of these amenities have gone down hill to the point that we no longer even mention them when discussing dinner plans.  In July there were two flies on the wall 12" away from my husbands shoulder, the wall was covered with filthy food splatters.  The restaurant overall is dirty.  The food has become only marginally acceptable with tough meat, small portions, unseasoned, and unpredictable recipes (lobster dip appetizer). The mixed drinks are way overpriced.   So sad to see this location go downhill as it has and we will not be returning.

DrA8AHz77umPmOWLifccRQ.text: Decided to do a late lunch/dinner stop! The food and service were exceptional! The Sesame Salmon was perfect in taste, and preparation! Would not hesitate to get it again! The sides of Parmesan mashed potatoes, and green beans with pecans were cooked perfectly. The service by Steve could not have been any better! The desert of a delicious chocolate brownie, with ice cream & camel sauce topped the meal off! This place deserves the high ratings!

n5vBgMxs0c4rDuapdxufuw.text: Very nice dining experience!  We visited Firebirds with two other couples, and were seated immediately on a Thursday evening around 6:30 pm.  Service was fast, attentive, and not overwhelming.  Steaks were fabulous.  Our server was absolutely superb at subtly upselling us - I could see it happening, but he was so charming about it that we bought into it (literally and figuratively), increasing our enjoyment of the experience.  Wine selection was great.  The meat-eaters had a very nice pinot noir and the seafood eaters had a very very nice pinot grigio.  I asked for an end-cut prime rib that was no more than medium, and got precisely what I asked for.  My wife got a small ribeye, rare, and also got exactly what she wanted.  Both portions were generous; I took half of mine home.  We all split two desserts.  Again, delicious, and very generous portions.

piv6vOasq_QK60PZW1nSnQ.text: Amazing service from our server Jacob! Super attentive and had some great suggestions for a first timer. The coconut shrimp is to die for the their passion fruit iced tea is extremely refreshing! There was a beautiful ambiance to the restaurant and my date and I had a wonderful time.

RnQ2VsVs57yWLba56sQ2Cw.text: Great food and great atmosphere.  I would recommend to anyone who would like a great steak or burger.  My favorite is the smokehouse burger with smoked cheddar cheese and bbq sauce.

Tw5zG77h2atb9fNKwC_sYQ.text: Growing up in Texas I've had more than my share of steak (particular Prime Rib). At the request of a personal friend (also a Chef) I decided to dine at Firebirds just for the Prime Rib. After having my server check to see if they had "True rare" Prime, I ordered it.  All that I can really say is that if you love beef the way I do, you wont be disappointed the least bit. I would even venture to say that it's in the top 3 best Prime I've ever experienced...including the one I make myself!

_s5HLK_tVsXoPrcQ_UZ0Sg.text: Great steak, amazing potatoes, very attentive service. Boyfriend and I both had the ribeye, wings, and a few drinks a piece. Bill with tip was a bit over $100--not bad!   Seems that others have had issue with the doneness of their steaks. I didn't have a problem. And I think steak doneness is a tough one. Oh well.  I didn't see any reviews about the bread. OMG. It is amazing--crusty on the outside, slightly chewy on the inside. But this is a grill, folks, so go for the steak (but you'll talk about the bread, trust me).

whBZXmOJg44BgUSiceuxIQ.text: Our first experience here was fairly well, (except peppercorn steak was WAY overloaded with peppercorn, we're talkin' 1/2" thick  of spice around the entire piece of meat. If you're into that kind of thing, I didn't like biting into 90% spice ande 10% meat. But it gets better as you work into it..  The second time we went left me saying, "What happened?.." When we first came in, they said the wait was going to be 5-10 min., we waited 20 min. I just figured the food was so good that people had to be forced to leave. Wrong. When we sat, the waiter got us waters and took our orders (Lobster bisque dip for appetizer, Medium Well Prime rib 16 oz. with baked potato and salmon salad-with no tomatos for entrees),  but didn't give us any bread at all (which we saw on every single table).   I swear we sat there for 25 min. sipping water before we got anything. I was getting more and more annoyed as we watched everybody around us receive food. Apparently, some other waiter had stolen our waiter's Lobster appetizer. Why didn't our waiter just tell us that instead of the runner girl? The runner apologized, and I was like okay...but then she left and we only had one appetizer plate to share this thing. Urg. Lobster dip did not have enough lobster bits in in, more queso than anything.  As the entrees arrived, they looked great. As I chewed off some meat, it was getting more rare and I dug deeper, more bloody and the taste just overwhelmed me. I couldn't continue. I don't like being the ass that asks for a 'redo', but there was no way I was going to eat this obviously Medium-Medium Rare steak. Hubs got tons of tomato in his salad which he requested not to have. I sent my steak back and the hubs complained about the tomatos and salmon that was a bit rare.   The manager was nice enough to give us $20 in gift cards to apologize for the mishaps we've had throughout the night, I just wish the waiter would have done more to make sure we were happy.

5acr7wys1_J0Plsa2p0oWg.text: If you want to spend a lot of money for a minimal amount of food this is the place to go. My boyfriend and I decided to try something different and go to Firebirds.  Our server was great! He seemed like a newbe but he was very sincere and always checking up on us, which we loved. The bread is pretty amazing but I've gone to cheaper places that have had just as good bread.  Once our plates arrived the food was good but we didnt have very much food on our plates. I was very disappointed by the $$$ to amount of food we were getting. In addition to the food, it was VERY loud and I think a lot of it comes from the kitchen being right off of the dining room.  All in all we will not be returning and we recommend you spend your money at Abuelos across the street. (Chandler Mall)

gWwWyuHPR-pfrEsMm1fwdQ.text: Loved my visit here. I was talked into the meatloaf for dinner. I have never ordered meatloaf at a restaurant, but tonight I did. The combination of meatloaf, and a bit of mashed potatoes and gravy on my fork......HEAVEN. I was sure to chew in every corner of my mouth....my taste buds were going crazy.......

Glp3R4NI0B9W7EYrMrZwhQ.text: Food was well prepared and tasty(blue cheese filet & salmon). Service was good. Only problem is the place was loud so probably not good for quiet conversation. A little pricey @ $30-40 pp (we dont drink). All in all a delicious meal.

e3YngiRnUX1Xbez0X_gsoQ.text: We like Firebirds. Service has always been great, and food is very good and reasonably priced. The bread they bring before your meal is delicious, especially when is hot from the oven.  I had tried the quesadillas, buffalo meatloaf, sirloin steak, and a pasta dish. The pasta was nothing to write home about.  My 1 1/2 yr old loved the mac & cheese, a definitely more upscale version than Kraft, made with penne and a white cheese sauce. I recently had the shrimp, strawberry and goat cheese salad and I really enjoyed it. The shrimp were a tad too salty, but over all it was very good. I loved the jicama and spicy pecans, it added a nice sweet crunch.   I must say that during one of our visits I was going to order the peppercorn crusted steak and the server was honest enough to tell me: Unless you reaaaaaally like pepper, you should order something else. I appreciated his honesty, because I was not interested in having steak with my peppercorns:) and I like (actually expect) my waiter to steer me in the right direction if I'm going to order something less than appetizing.

u10-_i4CyNgp9NlW_qR4aw.text: Great food, great service, highly recommend the pecan crusted trout!

38gHdUxLUYbPh2-aD0ZnLQ.text: I Called ahead on Saturday to make a reservation for some 20 family members for my wife's birthday on Sunday afternoon. Pedro the manager was enthusiastic in taking the information and said that he would make sure things were ready for the group. He even suggested that he may come in a bit earlier to assist and help us decorate if I chose. We arrived and everything was ready to go. The servers were Lauren and Yvette. The food and service was fantastic. My son stated the service was "Seamless" As "perfect as service can be for a group our size" We dine here or take out several times each month and always have enjoyed. But this experience was above and beyond. The Firebird's staff allowed my wife and our family to absolutely enjoy our get together. I would without doubt highly recommend this restaurant for dining at a reasonable menu cost! Thanks Pedro, Lauren and Yvette and those behind the scenes. You made this a perfect birthday event.

uoPvsqwFiVYCtI3bL_fkAg.text: Consistent!  We order the same for to go bi-weekly when we just don't feel like cooking, ahi app with side house salads, sweet potato fires and wings. Yummy!  Their ahi is very fresh and seared perfectly.  The house salad is served with cinnamon toasted pecans, and the sweet potato fries are naughty but nice!  I give it four stars instead of five because when waiting for your order at the bar, the drinks are poured without a sense of urgency, which we all need after a long week.

lXTJWMe7Ogjdk9SApIw8ew.text: this is my all-time favorite restaurant. i go every year for my birthday and order the filet.  the service is always phenomenal! our most recent waitress was from california (i don't remember her name) but she made small talk with us and seemed genuinely glad to be taking care of us. a few of the line cooks i had previously worked with at romano's maraconi grill (which has since closed down) were cooking. she kindly walked me up to the line to say hi! the filet is always cooked to perfection (or should i say not-so-cooked; i like mine still mooing) and be sure to add the green bean side for only $5. they're cinnamon-sweet! i usually go for the key lime pie as dessert, but recently i chose the creme brulee cheesecake. heaven in my mouth.

8BKyDIjJ660Lcs85V1c6Jw.text: I sat at the bar -right next to the fantastic fireplace. I had a cheeseburger with bacon, and a couple blue moons. The burger was fantastic- smoky flavor from the wood fire grill, crisp lettuce, onions, and tomato. Beer was very cold -and delicious... Bartenders were friendly, and the mood very relaxed in the cozy bar setting.  Firebirds is great, and I will try to make this a part of my fine dining rotation of favorites.

rWlbDPjqUhH0QGFwxQFm3Q.text: The customer sevice and ambiance here are always great. The managers have always taken care of any issue we've ever had.  The prime rib is really, really good! So is the Steak Au Poivre!  That said, I have to admit that the rest of the food can be pretty hit and miss. I've never had  awful food here, but several disappointments. The managers and staff are so polite and work so hard to make things right that we keep coming back.  The pricing is a bit high for the inconsistent quality, but well worth the early bird and happy hour pricing.

GuqD3UURtf8o8Edvzy-YLQ.text: Let me start off by saying I went to this restaurant last night for the first time. It seemed appealing so my mom and I decided to try it. The service was ok. Our first waitress was awesome. Then we got a new waiter for some reason and he was alright. My mom ordered the prime rib with a baked potato and I ordered the sirloin with mashed potatoes and we both got a green salad. Her prime rib was cooked medium well and my sirloin was cooked medium. My steak was burnt on the outside and really pink on the inside. It didn't taste too bad but it was hard to chew as it wasn't very tender. For the price of the food I at least expected it to come with 2 sides but you only get one and you can add more for a not so good price. After we were done spending our $69 plus tip on mediocre food and drinks we went home and we both started to feel sick. So we went to bed. The next day aka today we both had upset stomachs, the chills, and nausea. I have been throwing up and have been in and out of the bathroom all day. I have a headache and I am weak. I think it's safe to say we got food poisoning. Next time I will get a decent steak/meal at a good price at Texas Roadhouse. I'm mad that I spent $80 just to get sick off of this food. Never again!

qwMNnYfmgHiT-xlfT2FQlQ.text: BEST burger I have ever had! Shredded cheddar, applewood smoked bacon...always amazing, I come here regularly.

9h7Mnxo0urqlfObmIaLduw.text: I think Firebirds delivers on the atmosphere and misses on the food.  I have been there a few times and I have never found a single menu item that I would place in any column other than 'ok'.    I would never reccommend

gtb4gUcXpIEHAdXQiOTOgQ.text: The location is great as it is right off the freeway and near the Chandler Fashionsquare mall. The smell of the woodfire grill is evident when you enter but not overpowering. The restaurant was nice and classy. Prices were slightly high but my chicken sandwich was good. The chicken was tender and the veggies were fresh. The bun was very light and almost flakey. The fries were stale and unimpressive. The server seemed new and nervous. Overall I was satisfied but not overly impressed. I would go back.

ClGw5sasyqzCWwZ1xYK7tw.text: Sort of like a poor mans version of Ruth Chris's steak house  or a rich mans version of Frasher's steak house.  Food was good but not great. Service was very good.  Plenty of wine choices but very limited beer menu. I find it a shame when you have a nice place that thinks that wine is cultured but beer is not.

eeT2Bkpbf0DtTTkUyTKSTQ.text: Ate there during the last restaurant week.  Good food...had a blackened steak....vey good.  Have tried to go back on a Friday and/or Saturday...too many people to wait though.  I generally take this to mean the food is good.  Having said that I'm not willing to wait, so I move on.

qoEIaoC_vYrXB1yJ9qCT0w.text: Kaitlyn was an absolutely incredible server!  Let's start there because we all know a server can make or break one's dining experience - and thus the establishment's Yelp rating.  My son and I brought my hubby here for a birthday lunch so the great service was a welcomed addition to our little celebration.  The food was good - no real complaints there either - but hands down its the experience that made this a positive outing for us.  Thanks, Kaitlyn!

photos.caption: Photo of Firebirds Wood Fired Grill - Chandler, AZ, United States. WOW!  And a birthday card signed by the entire team.  Nice touch, Firebirds!
Photo of Firebirds Wood Fired Grill - Chandler, AZ, United States. Ribeye
Photo of Firebirds Wood Fired Grill - Chandler, AZ, United States. Yummy!

h28GB4iM1v4aU-nWFs4fvg.text: Excellent! My first visit! And the experience was great, i had lunch by the bar, and troy was very helpful , great customer service, and the food came out so quickly, i was surprised! And it was fresh and delicious! ( mondays they have a 1/2 off any 8oz wine) definitely my new spot! And prices are very reasonable!! Love ut here!

photos.caption: Photo of Firebirds Wood Fired Grill - Chandler, AZ, United States. Big daddy chocolate cake!!
Photo of Firebirds Wood Fired Grill - Chandler, AZ, United States. Grilled salmon! Excellent!
Photo of Firebirds Wood Fired Grill - Chandler, AZ, United States. This pineapple vodka was great!!!

SK2NU-HzFbu3No9Knj6MOw.text: I was in town for business and thought that it looks like a nice place.  So I googled the menu and it looked fabulous, so I thought I'd give it a try. Traveling alone on business can be uncomfortable but I was greeted nicely and I sat at the bar and the bartenders were fabulous and it's reasonably priced and the food was amazing, and it had great energy I will definitely go back.  It's really seemed like the employees enjoyed each other and there was no tension and a good flow, overall just a great experience.  Happy hour was priced amazingly and it was packed at 4:30 in the afternoon.

FWYZFMcEx3KRz-ENesaAUA.text: Johanna, our server, was absolutely AMAZING! We came for my birthday, our first time and sat out on the patio. The reason there is only 4 starts, is because we got here we decided to sit on patio because the weather was perfect. We wanted to enjoy the nice temps before it's too hot, and about 20 minutes after sitting down another couple came out to sit and the women decided she was cold and had the heaters put on. The heaters were beyond hot and made the experience awful. The manager agreed to turn it off and on but it never felt like it was off much. My 10 month old was bright red on his face and arms from the heat, but that didn't seem to matter. Johanna was great through the whole experience. The food was fabulous, but was hard to enjoy when you are sweating and worrying about your baby overheating. We couldn't move tables outside because the ones available were all high top and there was an hour wait inside. We did appreciate the manager taking care of some of the items on our bill for the inconvenience, but it was still uncomfortable all night. We will definitely come back for the food and for Johanna's service. Maybe sit inside, because it's not enjoyable with heat blowing on you outside.

l-57CZpxecSKvP_alQkHxQ.text: Inconsistent food, but mostly so, so.   On several visits, they couldn't get the steak temperature correct.   I ordered wine and received the half glass but was charged for the full. I prefer not to argue. That was our last visit. We went there probably five times before giving up on them.

fXOt54D1nBmJudxhVZftJQ.text: Fantastic food and service. Abdul is an excellent server and we enjoyed the atmosphere.

A6srYUJAobT4GspOk5b0lQ.text: I highly recommend this place! The food was great, my picky spouse had the lobster and filet, and it was cooked just as he asked. I had the shrimp and strawberry salad with goat cheese..amazing! Our server was Alexis Clark, she was very attentive and we loved her suggestions. We will definitely be back.

lcxIHtttlhehqL52z0ShUg.text: Honestly, I don't think Firebirds is bad, I just really am not a huge fan of most of the menu items. Usually I just end up going with a chicken Caesar salad.   I did, last time I visited, try their onion ranch rings, which were tasty. Their brownie for dessert wasn't bad either.   The decor is just a typical smokehouse/tavern feel. It's kind of dark in there except for in a few areas. The bar is large and it looks nice. They have a huge variety of liquor.  Overall, I'm not opposed to going to Firebird's but I probably won't go out of my way to choose it over some other places.

gxYvnseGg7Li5DeAzw6X7g.text: Tossed salad is served with an even coating of dressing, which is a rarity these days. Too often I find a bunch of crispy greens sitting in my bowl after I've exhausted the smidgen of dressing they give at most restaurants. The ribs are tender and tangy, the mashed potatoes are the perfect cap off complement. Our server, Michael, helped elevate the dining experience by providing great service. Strongly recommend to anyone with a hankering for a delicious meat-and-potatoes meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Firebirds Wood Fired Grill - Chandler, AZ, United States. Firebirds Wood Fired Grill in Chandler, AZ offers top-notch cuisine at affordable prices.

txSoEU_c8YLCvDRD_eyxsw.text: Great steak house and good service. We ate at the bar and the bartender Charlie was super. Recommend the double diamond cocktail.

OevtxeD2-qH9cYhH4rYHlw.text: Decent food and service, but it feels really commercialized and artificial, like it's trying really hard to be a Cheesecake Factory clone. It's touted as a steakhouse, but only in the sense that they're a restaurant that serves steak vs specializing in it. Again, nothing particularly awful about this place, but it just feels really cookie-cutter.

FdGybQ5jrVVw830UbQyK2Q.text: This was our first time visiting Firebirds. The interior was clean and dark, reminding me of The Keg or a similar steakhouse atmosphere. The staff was very kind, and the customer service excellent. They had some good tunes pumped in as well. We jammed out some Boz Scaggs while dining.  As an appetizer, we had the coconut shrimp. They were cooked well, and were in a bed of unique citrus slaw, which was a hit at the table. The warm bread was also well received. The outside was crusty and the inside soft and buttery. My husband and I had the portabella sandwich; he with fresh fruit and me with tater tots (don't judge me) and a vegetarian black bean soup. The tots were hot and crisp. The fruit was, in fact, fresh, but was your normal fruit cup medley. The sandwich was perfectly cooked, with just the right amount of balsamic - not too much to overpower. The rosemary focaccia was great, and absorbed the vinegar for a robust flavor. The vegetarian black bean soup was a bit too spicy for me, but packed tons of flavor. The first time around, I had to send it back because there was a giant unannounced ball of sour cream in the soup. I'm perplexed why one would list it as vegetarian, then drop a glob of animal product in there, which you find by surprise at the bottom of your bowl. I was disappointed in the ignorance of that menu move.  Our companions had the wood-grilled salmon with green beans and the pineapple chicken with garlic mashed potatoes. Both enjoyed their meals. The salmon was cooked perfectly, and the beans fresh and al dente.   Shared dessert was a warm carrot cake with warm caramel syrup. The piece of cake was huge... Definitely to be shared. The cream cheese frosting was utterly sinful. I had a cup of hot tropical green tea. They had a cute little box of Evolution tea. I enjoyed it greatly.  Lastly, I give huge props to our great server Aristotle. He was attentive and accommodating. He didn't split the bill like we asked, but that's not a big deal. My drink was always full, and an empty plate never stayed in the table for long. A replacement soup came fast and with apology, and leftovers promptly boxed and bagged.  For a party of 4, with meals, drinks, appetizers and dessert, the bill was around $150.  We felt thoroughly satisfied by our meal at Firebirds, and will certainly return in the future.

hWGNrHA9TSj2Y0Ee29T3Hg.text: This is honestly the best restaurant I have ever been to. My fiance and I have been about 10 times and have never once had a bad experience. We both have worked in the customer service industry for a long time and honestly I think other businesses should model after Firebirds.  The food is amazing. I usually get the peppercorn steak which is the best I've ever had and he gets the burger. The cheesecake is the best!!! I can't say enough wonderful things about this place. You can tell the staff truly enjoys their job and everyone helps each other out like family. I would recommend this place to anyone.   I have to say one last thing. I celebrated my birthday/engagement party there the staff made a design of a ring on my plate and said congrats, and several of the staff came by and congratulated me. How thoughtful! We will be long time customers for sure! Thank you for being a great business.

photos.caption: Photo of Firebirds Wood Fired Grill - Chandler, AZ, United States. Congratulating me on my Engagement from Firebirds!!!

1bNLVIH4AjIu3_lOAcTc1A.text: Super pricy but super worth it.   Came here at lunch time, so it was not as pricy as I thought. I got a seared salmon thing and a salad with grilles salmon. They were delicious. I saw some others get steaks... so next time I come back, it is steak time for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Firebirds Wood Fired Grill - Chandler, AZ, United States. Salad with grilles salmon
Photo of Firebirds Wood Fired Grill - Chandler, AZ, United States. Seared salmon

tTD3scpko-x1Rhc8Vmz32Q.text: Where do I even begin with this place?  First off, the atmosphere is everything you would expect, very friendly staff, the food is out of this world, the decor is everything you would want, and the food is amazing!!! (I know I already stated that). I ordered a cocktail red sangria and it was very smooth and I loved the bite size fruits I enjoyed after my drink.   I was contemplating between the New York strip or the delmonico and I ended up ordering the delmonico medium well and it was so buttery and tender and juicy and I'm getting hungry again writing this post.   The complimentary bread and butter is something so simple and what 95% of restaurants serve but they have a special kind of fresh warm sour dough complimentary bread. Absolutely amazing!   Overall, YOU SHOULD TRY THIS PLACE! Promise, You won't regret it.

f8MRo4HN-a_dePOqjgJJDg.text: Great experience with wonderful staff and great ambiance. Lobster tail was delicious as well as the salmon. Martini's were also tasty.

jvQCp-7TSGoRzTnQYszlbw.text: I love firebirds! Nice clean and friendly environment. Very fancy and you don't break the bank dining in here! One of the better places in town to get a steak. Try the cilantro chicken! That's one of my favorites.

IjCmrmEnh4SiPmayoinbbQ.text: I love Firebirds.  Went to this location when I was recently up in Phoenix for work.  We have one in Tucson that is just as good -- chain but a good chain.  Great, solid service and friendly staff.  This location was just as good as my local location.  Had the cheeseburger -- was craving one and it was fresh and cooked to order.  Skinny fries on the side (yum) and you can add a small salad on the side for a few bucks more.

OBVb-JkkJ7QH6nIIPPzyWw.text: Not from the area, so I found this place via Yelp. I was not disappointed. The service, food, and atmosphere was excellent.  I sat up at the bar and wasn't sure what to order. The bartended was kind enough to explain what were some popular dishes, as well as her favorites. I went with the delmonico, accompanied by a caesar salad. There was also a decent selection of beer.  I was excited to hear they are considering opening one where I live, but if not I will be happy to return to this location!

photos.caption: Photo of Firebirds Wood Fired Grill - Chandler, AZ, United States. The Delmonico Steak and au gratin potatos

z0Sww9YSGFzhW5WwFv_yEA.text: Great place great food great service.  Tina our server was the best ever!! kudos to whoever hired her

0fQQiW_p0Jid61SBCcIEuw.text: I was pleasantly surprised by their reasonable prices as the photos looked like a high end steakhouse.  I was even more surprised when the food came out and it exceeded expectations.   Everything was amazing especially the bread.  I could of just ate the bread as my meal!  I ordered the rib eye and baked potato and everything was cooked and seasoned perfectly.  Service and food prep was also extremely quick and friendly! I will be coming back the next time I'm in Chandler for work!

photos.caption: Photo of Firebirds Wood Fired Grill - Chandler, AZ, United States

yUq6uAAKPqXs_MZcKtI7Xg.text: We use to go to this location when they first opened. Having recently returned here after a bit so great experience in the Gilbert location, I will continue to go here and only to this location. Service was great, hostess was kind, and server was on point. Food was excellent!  Can't say the same about the newer Gilbert location where I left quite dissatisfied and disappointed.

-ndMxv-dyv9rYSVtpnmrHQ.text: Came here and had a nice dinner and the staff was very friendly starting right when you open the door.   I love the ambiance, dimly lit and romantic. We went to the bar area first and the bartender, wish I remembered her name, came right up to assist us after just being provided our waters. She requested the pomegranate sunrise martini for my friend and explained in detail what the ingredients were so we can make it at home...even wrote it down for us...She was amazing, very social and knowledgeable.  When we were seated, our waitress Gabriell, was very accommodating, very nice, and always checking on us. I had the center cut steak with the loaded baked potato, it was delicious, and I had the caramel brule' cheesecake was phenomenal!  You can see the chef's cook your meal in the back, in in clear view.   This is my second time here and I'll definitely be back again... thank you Firebirds staff!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Firebirds Wood Fired Grill - Chandler, AZ, United States. AMF ingredients, my fav!!!!

VKea_xBuQ8XMNJAkuh7ShA.text: It was Mother's Day, and our precious daughters (and son-in-laws / fiancees) elected to have us all meet her to throw a Mother's Day celebration for my Beloved.  As much as we have eaten out, we have never dined here - ever!  Whenever I see the word "grill" at an establishment, I always associate it with a Bar and Grill. Hence, my expectations are often automatically lowered.  That was definitely an incorrect assumption when it comes to Firebirds. This place is well appointed, expansive, inviting and classy. It is definitely unlike any preconceived notion that I had had about establishments such as these.  They were cordial in their greeting, prompt in their seating; in spite of our large party. And the service never missed a beat.  The food was excellent. Most of us ordered one of their steak offerings, although one went for the steak and shrimp, and another had the pork chops. The waiter was kind enough to offer my beloved an amazingly delicious flan cheesecake that she shared with all of us.   The only quibble was a too sweet dressing on her salad, but other than that it was a perfect evening, only made more perfect by the company we kept.

photos.caption: Photo of Firebirds Wood Fired Grill - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of Firebirds Wood Fired Grill - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of Firebirds Wood Fired Grill - Chandler, AZ, United States

6V4CfhyXawHsBjMupXufkA.text: We come here pretty often for lunch time and last night was our first visit for dinner. Called during lunch time to set up a dinner reservation for three at 6:30 PM.   We couldn't have asked for a more perfect evening- our server Jordan took such good care of us. Really made for an awesome night out with her attentiveness but not annoying. A line that can easily get crossed fast, lol.   This place reminds me of Houston's in Scottsdale. A little more of a dressier place but not stuffy. Great menu options to suit everyone and even has a kids menu. They bring you a nice small loaf of bread with room temperature butter- if you know me, you know that I greatly appreciate this! Nothing worse than trying to spread cold butter on hot bread.  Started with the smoked wings. Nice smoke flavor and right amount of sauce. Some may say it's not spicy enough- I happen to like mild wings so this was perfect for me.  For my entree- I ordered the meatloaf. Comes with two thick slices of meatloaf perfectly seasoned and tender. Airy mashed potatoes and green beans with candied pecan pieces. The meatloaf comes with a nice mushroom gravy sauce. You can certainly make two meals out of this entree as it very rich. Ended up packing a slice of meatloaf, potatoes and green beans to take for leftovers. Will definitely order this dish again.  For dessert we had the lemon cake. Was told it's a new summertime dessert offering. You get a decent slice of cake that's nice and cold! Comes with a little thing of blackberry sauce that is also served cold. That cake was so delicious! It's definitely been a while since we have had cold cake and appreciated that detail.

photos.caption: Photo of Firebirds Wood Fired Grill - Chandler, AZ, United States. Kobe beef meatloaf so yummy
Photo of Firebirds Wood Fired Grill - Chandler, AZ, United States. Small bread loaf that&#39;s nice and warm. Room temp butter
Photo of Firebirds Wood Fired Grill - Chandler, AZ, United States. Smoked wings think it&#39;s 9 or 10 of them. Like the cilantro garnish, could have used more of it personally

P6AltnLfNLJKPdyYJgLaVg.text: I was treated to this location on my second day in Arizona. I was entirely pleased to have visited this location because the food was delicious. The complimentary bread was delicious and pleasant. I ordered some appetizers which consisted of deviled eggs that came with bacon and jalapenos which were to die for. I also ordered the fried shrimp tossed in siracha and mayo. I ordered the pineapple chicken skewers and cheesy potatoes. The food was delicious and juicy with very minimal complaints. I think if I had to order something again I would try the steaks because they looked as if they would have been worth every penny.

photos.caption: Photo of Firebirds Wood Fired Grill - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of Firebirds Wood Fired Grill - Chandler, AZ, United States. Sriracha Mayonnaise Shrimp
Photo of Firebirds Wood Fired Grill - Chandler, AZ, United States. Deviled eggs

9ihFhPWMHPSfk0sw0UBzQQ.text: A great value for similarly priced steakhouses. I prefer the flavor, price, selection and freshness of Firebirds over The Keg. The portions are generous, I am pretty sure my 10oz prime rib was larger than advertised.  A pet peeve of mine when it comes to prime rib is when the restaurant roasts the rib to rare, or medium rare then sticks my plate under the broiler to get my "medium" order which is really easy to spot and basically ruins the order. That is never the case at Firebirds. Perfectly roasted properly and served with au jus and creamy horseradish. Not fatty or chewy either.  The fresh sourdough loaves are also endless and soft as pillows. I love their loaded baked potatoes because they are soft and fresh. Pet peeve number 2 is the reheated baked potato, which is the norm at most restaurants these days. A fresh baked potato is fluffy in the inside, not dense.  The dessert menu could use some attention. I also recommend making a reservation through OpenTable because this location is very busy.

photos.caption: Photo of Firebirds Wood Fired Grill - Chandler, AZ, United States. Prime rib 12oz cooked medium

1FES9I7ly7n9eMndK86qvg.text: If service were the only item to rate, this place would be a 10. The issue was the lackluster food.  Was here with some colleagues and the service was spectacular at every turn. Friendly, efficient, and always there at just the right time.  Even when 2 of the steaks were cooked very wrong, they made it all right and handled it appropriately. I always feel like it's not a big deal when mistakes are made, if they take care of it and they absolutely did.  The actual food quality and was just mediocre. The salads were just meh. The dessert was even sort of middle of the road. Nothing jumped out.  Would I go back? Yes but only because the server was amaze balls!

Z5TbvMm1O45ngCWSj_nujg.text: Prologue: An online search for a nice place to have Valentine's Day dinner yielded this result along with several good reviews.   The Plot: We began by sharing the Seared Ahi Tuna appetizer (served with mixed greens, San Saba Farms spiced pecans, and spicy mustard sauce).  That was followed by two entrees, including the Cilantro-Grilled Chicken Breast (served with crisp ranch rings and smoked tomato jack cheese sauce) and the Seasonal Grilled Salmon Bowl ( wood-grilled salmon over a warm salad of organic ancient grains, toasted pecans, asparagus, roasted red peppers, craisins and goat cheese, drizzled with citrus vinaigrette).   The Scene: We arrived about 15 minutes prior to our 7:00pm reservation time on Valentine's Day and it was immediately apparent that the restaurant was as very busy as usual. However, they had set up some additional tables and we were seated right on time. Despite being busy, the place still had a cozy feel to it and it was nicely decorated for the holiday.   The service was prompt and friendly and our server visited our table just often enough to fully meet our needs, but not too often to be intrusive. She was also very accommodating when fulfilling my fiancee's special requests.   The Ahi tuna was tender, properly prepared, and had a nice, meaty flavor. My fiancee loved the spicy mustard sauce and asked for some extra on the side for dipping.   The grilled chicken breast was cooked as well as could be expected to achieve the proper balance between flavor, texture, and safety. The two pieces of chicken breast were served in the shape of a heart, which was a nice touch. The smoked tomato jack cheese sauce was very yummy and luxurious. I ordered a side of Port Mushrooms, which were the star of the meal for me. The portion size was very generous and I would highly recommend ordering this along with any chicken or beef entree.   My fiancee was also very pleased overall with her salmon entree and was particularly impressed with how perfectly the fished was cooked and seasoned.   The Rest of the Story: The prices were reasonable considering the popularity of the holiday and the great service made it well worth it.   The only minor disappointment was that the seasoning on the seared tuna was a bit too strong, however we still enjoyed it.   Prologue: This Valentine's Day dining experience turned out to be one of the best in recent memory.  Photo Design By: Billie Z.

4sR69496MPVClOs1Bxupkg.text: What an amazing experience!  We originally made the mistake of giving Black Angus another chance, yet it took about 20 minutes without anything to drink and such poor service that we simply asked for our check and left.    Thankfully, we decided to go to Firebirds Wood Fired Grill and it was a completely different experience! Our service was impeccable, our waiter (Abdul) was awesome - so courteous and friendly and very attentive, and the food was cooked perfectly and the service was awesome! All I could say is wow!  We will make it a point to come back to this place often!

UdJ68hAinKCDMrHg4QNUeA.text: We had lunch here and tried their wood grill salmon and sesame salmon entree. Both were delicious. Came with veggies and a choice of sides. Their sweet potato fries were my favorite. Their steak fries came out lukewarm though.   As for dessert, the chocolate cake was absolutely to die for. It was giant slice and was big enough for about 6 people to share. This alone was worth the trip here. Enjoy!

GivRxqetwIHB8OvsVCXmsw.text: Came from California for company meetings for a week  so me and my co workers had to find great local restaurants to find in while being in Arizona. After looking at Yelp reviews and menus decided to come here and try this place out since the  reviews where positive.  When we arrived on a Wednesday night at 7pm the restaurant was full of people which is a good sign. We were told we would wait 30-40 minutes. We decided to wait on the bar. The bartender was nice to serve is some drinks while we waited. After close to an hour we got called.  After we sat on our table they took our drink orders. We ordered Aged Rib Eye steak( medium rare) cause we were told it's good. The food to about 25 minutes to come which is average but it seemed longer since our waiter forgot to bring us some complementary bread he was supposed to bring to us. When we got our steak we we like Wow that's a great steak. Tender,  juicy and delicious like a good steak should be. Service overall was great as far as refilling our drink orders.  We actually enjoyed the steak so much that we had to come back the next night. On our second night (Thursday) we made a reservation  so we didn't need to wait about an hour.  Once we got there we got seated within 5 minutes. I ordered this time prime rib medium rare as well. Then we received our complementary bread which was crusty and fresh baked. We had to order another one. 10 minutes later the manager approached us and told us the didn't have any medium rare prime rib but as if we where in with medium well. We decided to change our orders to aged NY Steak. Wow the NY steak was also delicious it was so good!! The waiter said the manager didn't have our Caesar salads charged because of not having what we ordered. That's great service I can say. Our waiter (Tatyana) was awesome in taking care of us. That's why I'm giving them 5 stars!!  Restaurant is very nice and clean!! It makes you feel warm place to be and fine place to dine with families and friends. Restroom was very clean the 2 times I visited this restaurant.  Is located next to Chandler Fashion Center so you'll need to drive around to find parking. It took us only 5 minutes to find parking.  I definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone whom wants a great steak without breaking the bank. When I come back to Chandler AZ I will come back to do updated review for sure.

r67GOHsvzSSLIO1OlyQjaQ.text: All I can say is wow. The food is out of this world. We had the jalapeno deviled eggs, insanely good. The cilantro chicken is delicious and the Kobe meatloaf was incredible! Our server Erykka was fast, friendly, attentive, everything you could hope for in a server. Nikki the service manager is simply amazing!! We had a great experience and will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Firebirds Wood Fired Grill - Chandler, AZ, United States. Jalapeno deviled eggs, wow!!

oLLIycKxq29-FyEUZySdNQ.text: (The food is good but I said medium rare on my new york steak not medium well.. but was too hungry to complain so I just ate my food..)  I made reservations for 10 people because today is my dad's birthday. On the phone the lady asked me if there was a celebration going on and I said 'yes its my dad's birthday'.. We got there just in time but we didn't get seated till 15 mins after. I don't understand what's the point of a reservation..  When we got our meal, they mixed my uncle's food and one of my sister's food because one was supposed to be medium and the other was medium rare and both with loaded baked potato. My uncle just complained but both were halfway finished with their meal. But it was too late to and in my order- I ordered new york strip steak and I specifically told the waitress before she even asked that it should be medium rare.. almost done with my food now knowing that my new york strip steak came out medium well not medium rare. I wasn't satisfied but I just ate coz I was hungry.. didn't finish my food though and I love new york strip steak but come on.. medium rare is so much better!!  Our waitress handed us the bill which was given to us already without cake to celebrate for my dad.. and one of  my sister's said "Its ok I bought cake. We'll celebrate at home."  Just overall, thank you to the manager though who could accomodate last minute with my family coming over for dinner!

Z7IzuNVSpAn8ndD7oaHcHg.text: This was my first time here but came here for my mother's bday and I must say, it was delicious. The 21 day aged filet mignon was everything they said and more. Melt in your mouth goodness.   That's not all, the service was wonderful! We had Mikayla as our server and she was very friendly and attentive. It was super busy but she definitely made her rounds and and was punctual. Bravo.   Will definitely be back again.

PH_Wr_q8E2byG23AussQAg.text: I think the food is 4 stars. The steaks are huge and come with delicious sides. The problem that I had was the wait time for the food, the service, and cheap wine. We had a huge group of 10 and most of us ordered prime ribs. The prime rib was super thick and tender. I will say, I normally prefer mine medium rare but because of how soft it was, it was fine medium. If you're ordering prime rib here, I'd order it a notch below what you normally do. We had the lobster queso and strawberry shrimp salad as an appetizer. Both were very tasty. It was a small shrimp portion for a 16$ salad. I only remember seeing 4. The Caesar salad that comes with the entree had a weird flavor. Like a modified Caesar, wasn't a fan. The kids meals I got were steak and chicken tenders. I like that the kids' meals come with honest juice and 2 sides. The macaroni and cheese was described as a noodle but was penne, I had hoped for more of a spaghetti type based on description. There wasn't much flavor to the penne. The kid steak was a very substantial portion 4-5oz. My 2 kids were able to split it and still have some left over. My sisters both love eating here over the Keg but I love the Keg for the amazing food & service( we were just there yesterday). Even though we had two servers, I feel like it was very blotchy and inconsistent. I had to ask for A1 twice, I didn't get a water and I swear she said they are washing cups right now...excuse me what? What restaurant runs out of cups? I asked for my kids meals to come out first since it was late and it still took 30 mins. My daughter was waiting for the A1 but since it took so long, her steak got cold. First world problems obviously but these are the things that stick out in my head when deciding on if I should re-visit. The two people next to our large table seemed upset about speed of food too. Lastly, I'd like to complain about wine. How does an expensive restaurant like this choose wines that are 7-9$ a bottle? Mine tasted like rubbing alcohol. I couldn't finish it. We had the brownie dessert and that was like crack. The brownie was like a soft cakey brownie with ice cream and liquid caramel on the side. That was absolutely to die for. I see why my sisters love the food here but I'm not sure about the service. The service can make or break your experience anywhere.

photos.caption: Photo of Firebirds Wood Fired Grill - Chandler, AZ, United States. Prime rib with green beans was yummy!
Photo of Firebirds Wood Fired Grill - Chandler, AZ, United States. Lobster Spinach Queso was delish!
Photo of Firebirds Wood Fired Grill - Chandler, AZ, United States. Kid steak, penne tasted as dull as it looks.

DUm8TPODPLsyqaB9YrwZQQ.text: I've always enjoyed my meals here and the service at the bar is awesome! I usually get the spinach and lobster queso dip and I always have them add bacon bits to put it over the top!! Yum!   They also have this wonderful drink that contains vodka and fresh pineapple! It's delicious!! I don't know the name of it, but it's da bomb!
